result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher Deshawn McGinnis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 1st-Degree Intentional Homicide [Modifiers: Party to a Crime, Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class A felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.01(1)(a).
  • Possession of Firearm by Felon, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2).
  • 1st-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety [Modifiers: Party to a Crime, Use Dangerous Weapon (Felony 5+ Yrs)], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $4,000.00, surcharges applicable. To be paid in amounts of: $2,000.00 to Crime Victim Compensation Program, and $2,000.00 to Barbara Williams.

The Court imposed applicable fees, assessments, restitution, Court costs, surcharges including DNA assessment.  DOC to collect all monetary amounts at the rate of maximum 25% of any amounts provided in Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and 973.20 while defendant is in their control.  Any monetary amounts that remain unpaid when the defendant is released from confinement are to be paid  as a condition of the Extended Supervision.  Any unpaid balance reduced to a civil judgment against the defendant and can then proceed under Sec. 71.935  as well as other collection procedures.
-You may have to give a swab, which you might be able to have expunged under 165.77.

Credit of 186 days.  
Defendant is eligible for Extended Supervision in 27 years.

Provide a DNA sample for the data bank, pay all appropriate costs.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor; also advised that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
COUNTS TWO AND THREE: see count one.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with count one.  Credit for 186 days.

superMiscConds.notes:
All conditions of Extended Supervision shall be determined by DOC.
Maintain absolute sobriety. Random urine screens.

supervisions.notes:
Concurrent with: Concurrent with count one. Credit for 186 days.
**Court did not address the Challenge Incarceration Program or Wisconsin Substance Program.

records.addlTxt: Associated with Charge #3

Defendant Christopher Deshawn McGinnis in court with attorney Hazel Jean Washington.  Defendant Christopher Deshawn McGinnis in custody.  Karl Peter Hayes appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Presentence report reviewed.  Statements made as to sentencing.  
AS TO COUNT 1: The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF LIFE  IMPRISONMENT with credit for 186 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is LIFE the DEFENDANT IS ELIGIABLE FOR EXTENDED SUPERVISION in 27 YEARS.  The court did not address the Challenge Incarceration Program and the "Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program".
AS TO COUNT 2: The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 10 YEARS CONCURRENT TO COUNT 1, with credit for 186 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 5 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 5 YEARS.  The court did not address the Challenge Incarceration Program and the "Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program".
AS TO COUNT 3: The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 12 YEARS AND 6 MONTHS CONCURRENT TO COUNT 1, with credit for 186 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 7 YEARS and 6 MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 5 YEARS.  The court did not address the Challenge Incarceration Program and the "Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program".
ALL CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISON SHALL BE DETERMINED BY THE DOC. 
*Maintain absolute sobriety with random urine screens.
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
Restitution $4000 (surcharges applicable) in the amount of $2000 payable to the Crime Victim Compensation Program and $2000 payable to Barbara Williams. 
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored. 
The Court is imposing the applicable fees, assessments, restitution court costs, and surcharges, including a DNA assessment.  You may have to give a swab, which you might be able to have expunged under 165.77.
The Court orders the DOC to collect any monetary amounts ordered today at the rate of max 25% of any amounts provided in secs 973.05(4)(b) and 973.20 while the defendant is in their control.  Any monetary amounts that remain unpaid when the defendant is released from confinement are to be paid as a condition of the extended supervision.  Any monetary mounts that remain unpaid when the sentence is completed are ordered reduced to a judgment against the defendant for the unpaid balance and collection can then proceed under sec. 71.935 as well as other collection procedures.
Filed,

Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit;

Exhibit List received and filed with the court.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT PRODUCED FOR PURPOSES OF THE SENTENCING IN BRANCH 7.

At the hour of 10:59 am the jury returned and, by their foreperson, brought in a verdict of.....

(GUILTY)  AS TO COUNT 1:  1st Degree Intentional Homicide  - PTAC, as Party to a Crime. "Did the Defendant, or another who he acted as a party to a crime with, commit the offense of 1st Degree Intentional Homicide while using a dangerous weapon?" "Yes." 

(GUILTY)  AS TO COUNT 2:  Possession of a Firearm by a Felon.

(GUILTY) AS TO COUNT 3:  1st Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety - PTAC, as Party to a Crime.  "Did the Defendant, or another who he acted as a party to a crime with, commit the offense of 1st Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety while using a dangerous weapon?" "Yes."

which was then read.  Court polled and discharged the jury.  Verdict received and filed.  Court granted State's motion for judgment on the verdict and denied defense motion for judgment not withstanding the verdict.  Court ordered entry of judgment of conviction.   Court ordered Defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department. PSI ORDERED BY THE COURT.  COURT WILL RETAIN FILE.

Defendant Christopher Deshawn McGinnis in court with attorney Hazel Jean Washington.  Defendant Christopher Deshawn McGinnis in custody.  Karl Peter Hayes appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Jury retired at the hour of 09:31 am to deliberate in the charge of Sheriff's Deputy Mark Pawlak; Deputy Michael Johnson was previously sworn on 12-04-2015, who were duly sworn for that purpose.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 29, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defense motion for a directed verdict at the close of the state's case is denied by the Court.

Arguments heard as to bail. The defendant previously entered a speedy trial demand in this case. Court set a signature bond in the amount of $75,000.00 with turnover to Justice Point GPS Monitoring. 24 HOUR CURFEW with the following conditions:
-No contact with any of the witnesses listed on the State's Witness List filed 5/18/15 nor any third party contact with the exception of the defendant's mother Hazel M. 

Case recalled. Defendant not in court. Court will allow the defendant release for visits with his attorney. Visits to last no more than 3 hours (including travel time) and MUST be confirmed in advance by Justice Point.

Case set for jury trial. In chambers discussions placed on the record. State requested an adjournment due to unavailability of an essential witness. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 5, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for August 10, 2015 at 09:30 am.
Case in court for final pre-trial. State placed negotiations on the record. Case remains calendared for Jury Trial in Branch 25 on 07/06/2015 at 9:00am. Case adjourned to Branch 25.

Attorney Hazel Jean Washington in court, defendant Christopher Deshawn McGinnis not in court, in custody.  Grant Ian Huebner appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for final pretrial. Branch 25 is in trial and unable to hear this matter. State filed an Amended Information. Defendant charged as follows:

COUNT 1- First Degree Intentional Homicide, Use of a Dangerous Weapon, as a Party to a Crime, contrary to sec. 940.01(1)(a), 939.50(3)(a), 939.05, 939.63(1)(b) Wis. Stats., a Class A Felony.

COUNT 2 remains the same. 

COUNT 3- First Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety, Use of a Dangerous Weapon, as a Party to a Crime, contrary to sec. 941.30(1), 939.50(3)(f), 939.05, 939.63(1)(b) Wis. Stats., a Class F Felony.

Attorney Hazel Jean Washington in court, defendant Christopher Deshawn McGinnis not in court, in custody.  Antoni J. Apollo appeared via telephone. Case set for Scheduling Conference. Case heard off the record. Defendant NOT produced. Defense received discovery and an offer. Defense requests Final Pretrial and Jury Trial dates. Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND. Due to defense counsel's calendar, defense requests Jury Trial date be scheduled one week outside of the Speedy Trial time frame.  Parties to file motions by 4/14/2015. Any motions requiring testimony will be heard on the final pretrial date. Parties to file witness lists, jury instructions, and motions in limine by the final pretrial date. State to file proposed verdict forms and substantive jury instructions by the final pretrial date. Case adjourned to branch 25.  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for July 6, 2015 at 09:00 am.
